title: Add lawfulness & values-aligned support area with clear non-guarantee disclaimers

requirements.text: Add explicit UI disclaimers stating the app does not provide legal advice, does not provide religious/spiritual rulings, and cannot guarantee perfect compliance with any laws or religious rules; ensure all user-facing disclaimer text is in English and is shown alongside existing safety disclaimers.

quotes: help me follow the laws of the land perfectly, 100% eternally, and the laws of all religions perfectly.

acceptanceCriteria: The disclaimers UI includes separate sections for: (1) Not Legal Advice, (2) Not Religious/Spiritual Authority, and (3) No Guarantees/Limitations (explicitly rejecting “perfect/100%/eternal” compliance promises).
The new disclaimer sections appear wherever the existing disclaimers component is rendered (e.g., Settings and Crisis/Help pages).
All new disclaimer strings are written in English.

requirements.text: Create a new signed-in page for “Staying Safe & Out of Trouble” (lawful + values-aligned decision support) that provides practical, non-judgmental self-management content (e.g., grounding steps, a pause-and-plan checklist, and links to Crisis/Help) without claiming prevention or compliance guarantees.

quotes: Creating an app that keeps me out of jail, prison, and baker-act institutions. No institutionalizations. No matter what.
help me follow the laws of the land perfectly, 100% eternally, and the laws of all religions perfectly.

acceptanceCriteria: A new route is available in the authenticated app (via TanStack Router) for the new “Staying Safe & Out of Trouble” page.
The page includes: (a) a short ‘pause’ checklist, (b) grounding steps, and (c) a prominent link/button to the existing /crisis-help page.
The page text avoids absolute guarantees (e.g., does not promise ‘keeps me out of jail/institutions’ or ‘perfect compliance’).
The page is discoverable from the main app navigation (AppShell nav).

requirements.text: Allow the user to save and edit a personal “commitments & boundaries” plan used by the “Staying Safe & Out of Trouble” page (e.g., personal commitments, things to avoid, and ‘when I’m at risk, I will…’ steps) and persist it per-user in the Motoko backend.

quotes: keeps me out of jail, prison, and baker-act institutions
help me follow the laws of the land perfectly, 100% eternally, and the laws of all religions perfectly

acceptanceCriteria: Backend exposes authenticated, caller-scoped query/update methods to read and write the user’s saved plan data.
Frontend provides an editor UI on the “Staying Safe & Out of Trouble” page to view/update the saved plan and shows a success/failure state on save.
Plan data is user-private (only accessible to the signed-in principal) and remains available after reload/sign-out/sign-in.
No part of the UI or backend describes the plan as guaranteeing outcomes or perfect compliance.

constraints: Backend must remain a single Motoko actor in backend/main.mo; add backend/migration.mo only if required by persistent state changes.
Do not edit files under frontend/src/components/ui or other immutablePaths; compose existing UI components instead.
Do not claim or imply guarantees of perfect legal/religious compliance, avoidance of incarceration/institutionalization, or emergency/crisis intervention.
Use English for all user-facing text added or modified.
nonGoals: Providing legal counsel, legal strategy, or jurisdiction-specific legal determinations.
Providing religious rulings, authoritative interpretation of holy texts, or claiming to enforce/verify religious compliance.
Any promise of “100%”, “perfect”, “eternal” compliance or outcome guarantees (e.g., ‘no jail’, ‘no institutionalizations’).
Real-time monitoring, law enforcement integration, or external service integrations (push notifications, SMS, email, third-party auth).
